   20: 
   21: %%
   22: 
   23: -module(odbc_start_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: %% Note: This directive should only be used in test suites.
   26: -compile(export_all).
   27: 
   28: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   29: -include("odbc_test.hrl").
   30: 
   31: %% Test server callback functions
   32: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   33: %% Function: init_per_suite(Config) -> Config
   34: %% Config - [tuple()]
   35: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
   36: %% Description: Initialization before the whole suite
   37: %%
   38: %% Note: This function is free to add any key/value pairs to the Config
   39: %% variable, but should NOT alter/remove any existing entries.
   40: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   41: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   42:     case odbc_test_lib:skip() of
   43: 	true ->
   44: 	    {skip, "ODBC not supported"};
   45: 	false ->
   46: 	    case code:which(odbc) of
   47: 		non_existing ->
   48: 		    {skip, "No ODBC built"};
   49: 		_ ->
   50: 		    %% Make sure odbc is not already started
   51: 		    odbc:stop(),
   52: 		    ct:timetrap(?TIMEOUT),
   53: 		    [{tableName, odbc_test_lib:unique_table_name()} | Config]
   54: 	    end
   55:     end.
   56: 
   57: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   58: %% Function: end_per_suite(Config) -> _
   59: %% Config - [tuple()]
   60: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
   61: %% Description: Cleanup after the whole suite
   62: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   63: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   64:     ok.
   65: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   66: %% Function: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) -> Config
   67: %% Case - atom()
   68: %%   Name of the test case that is about to be run.
   69: %% Config - [tuple()]
   70: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
   71: %%
   72: %% Description: Initialization before each test case
   73: %%
   74: %% Note: This function is free to add any key/value pairs to the Config
   75: %% variable, but should NOT alter/remove any existing entries.
   76: %% Description: Initialization before each test case
   77: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   78: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   79:     ct:pal("ODBCINI = ~p~n", [os:getenv("ODBCINI")]),
   80:     Config.
   81: 
   82: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   83: %% Function: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) -> _
   84: %% Case - atom()
   85: %%   Name of the test case that is about to be run.
   86: %% Config - [tuple()]
   87: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
   88: %% Description: Cleanup after each test case
   89: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   90: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
   91:     ok.
   92: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   93: %% Function: all(Clause) -> TestCases
   94: %% Clause - atom() - suite | doc
   95: %% TestCases - [Case] 
   96: %% Case - atom()
   97: %%   Name of a test case.
   98: %% Description: Returns a list of all test cases in this test suite
   99: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  100: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  101: 
  102: all() -> 
  103:     case odbc_test_lib:odbc_check() of
  104: 	ok -> [app, appup, start, long_connection_line];
  105: 	_Other -> [app, appup]
  106:     end.
  107: 
  108: groups() -> 
  109:     [].
  110: 
  111: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  112:     Config.
  113: 
  114: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  115:     Config.
  116: 
  117: 
  118: 
  119: %% Test cases starts here.
  120: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  121: 
  122: %% Test that the odbc app file is ok
  123: app(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  124:     ok = test_server:app_test(odbc).
  125: 
  126: %% Test that the odbc appup file is ok
  127: appup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  128:     ok = test_server:appup_test(odbc).
  129: 
  130: start() -> 
  131:     [{doc,"Test start/stop of odbc"}].
  132: start(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
  133:     PlatformOptions = odbc_test_lib:platform_options(),
  134: 	{error,odbc_not_started} = odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(),
  135: 					    PlatformOptions),
  136:     odbc:start(),
  137:     case odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), PlatformOptions) of
  138: 	{ok, Ref0} ->
  139: 	    ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref0),
  140: 	    odbc:stop(),
  141: 	    {error,odbc_not_started} = 
  142: 		odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), PlatformOptions),
  143: 	    start_odbc(transient),
  144: 	    start_odbc(permanent);
  145: 	{error, odbc_not_started} ->
  146: 	    ct:fail(start_failed);
  147: 	Error ->
  148: 	    ct:pal("Connection failed: ~p~n", [Error]),
  149: 	    {skip, "ODBC is not properly setup"}
  150:     end.
  151:     
  152: start_odbc(Type) ->
  153:     ok = odbc:start(Type),
  154:     case odbc:connect(?RDBMS:connection_string(), odbc_test_lib:platform_options()) of
  155: 	{ok, Ref} ->
  156: 	    ok = odbc:disconnect(Ref),
  157: 	    odbc:stop();
  158: 	{error, odbc_not_started} ->
  159: 	    ct:fail(start_failed)
  160:     end.
  161: 
  162: 
  163: long_connection_line()->
  164:     [{doc,"Test a connection line longer than 127 characters"}].
  165: long_connection_line(_Config)  ->
  166:     odbc:start(),
  167:     String133 = "unknown_odbc_parameter=01234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789",
  168:     {error, Reason} = odbc:connect(String133, []),
  169:     odbc:stop(),
  170:     ct:pal("Driver error reason: ~p",[Reason]).
